title: Saudi Arabia energy minister says post-attack ethane output recovering
text:
FILE PHOTO: Saudi Energy minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman speaks during a news conference in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia September 17, 2019. REUTERS/Waleed Ali

CAIRO (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia’s energy minister said on Wednesday that the ethane gas output of the kingdom is now at 900 million standard cubic feet as it recovers from the attacks on the Abqaiq and Khurais facilities on Sept. 14, the Saudi state news agency reported.

Energy minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman added that the total current domestic demand is 940 million standard cubic feet per day.
description: Saudi Arabia's energy minister said on Wednesday that the ethane gas output of the kingdom is now at 900 million standard cubic feet as it recovers from the attacks on the Abqaiq and Khurais facilities on Sept. 14, the Saudi state news agency reported.
